bibl.title: Letter from [Rupert Blue] to Henry Rose Carter, December 5, 1919

div1.p: [Blue] orders Carter to proceed to Florida for mosquito control work.

div1.head: Letter from [Rupert Blue] to Henry Rose Carter, December 5, 1919
div1.opener:
Mise
File Detail
RP
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
December 5, 1919.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
The Bureau is in receipt of a request from the
State Health Officer of Florida that you proceed to
that State to give the authorities information in
regard to the eradication of the yellow fever mos-
quito.

A copy of the State Health Officer's letter is
inclosed for your information.

The Bureau will appreciate a statement from
you as to whether you think it would be practicable
for you to comply with Dr. Greene's request.
By direction of the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
Respectfully,
Assistant Surgeon General. Answered-telling of
Inc.
Wrote again Dec 10
